description: A structured method for evaluating whether a B2B opportunity is advancing, neutral, or stalled based on buyer-driven signals, used for pipeline inspection and forecast quality.

momentum_states.definition: Buyer behavior indicates clear internal movement toward a decision.
examples: Technical teams request documentation or access
Buyer shares internal workflows or data

momentum_states.definition: Activity exists, but it is primarily vendor-led and does not prove internal movement.
examples: Surface-level curiosity without clear next steps
Buyer listens but does not add stakeholders
Requests for more information without action

momentum_states.definition: Signals indicate slowing, stalling, or regression in the opportunity.
examples: No new stakeholders appear over time

momentum_signals.name: Engagement Depth
momentum_signals.description: Measures how deeply the buyer engages and how much meaningful information they share.

interpretation.1: Minimal or transactional responses; no meaningful insight shared.
interpretation.3: Buyer engages but keeps the conversation high-level.
interpretation.5: Buyer openly shares workflows, constraints, and internal dynamics.

momentum_signals.name: Stakeholder Expansion
momentum_signals.description: Tracks whether additional influencers or decision makers are joining the process.

interpretation.1: Single point of contact with no progress adding others.
interpretation.3: Adjacent stakeholders appear, but no senior decision makers.
interpretation.5: Decision makers and cross-functional teams actively participate.

momentum_signals.name: Internal Activity
momentum_signals.description: Assesses the amount of work the buyer is doing internally without vendor prompting.

interpretation.3: Some internal discussions or informal validation.
interpretation.5: Formal reviews, ROI analysis, or internal pitches are in progress.

momentum_signals.name: Reciprocity
momentum_signals.description: Evaluates whether the buyer matches the seller's effort with their own actions.

interpretation.1: Seller does all the work; buyer passively consumes.
interpretation.5: Buyer consistently drives tasks, brings materials, and pushes momentum.

momentum_signals.name: Organizational Energy
momentum_signals.description: Captures internal urgency, executive sponsorship, and strategic relevance.

interpretation.1: No urgency; project is optional or speculative.
interpretation.3: Some pressure or KPI alignment, but timing is flexible.
interpretation.5: Clear deadlines, regulatory or competitive pressure, and senior sponsorship.

scoring_model.description: Each opportunity is scored 1–5 on all five signals. The sum is used to interpret pipeline momentum.

total_score_interpretation.20-25: Strong positive momentum. High probability of close if execution risks are managed.
total_score_interpretation.14-19: Conditional momentum. Deal can close but is vulnerable to stalls in one or two areas.
total_score_interpretation.8-13: At-risk opportunity. Requires targeted intervention and potential reframing.
total_score_interpretation.0-7: Stalled or low-probability opportunity. Remove from near-term forecast unless conditions change.

required_momentum_action.name: Required Momentum Action
required_momentum_action.definition: A single, buyer-led action that confirms the opportunity is still progressing.
examples: Introduce procurement or legal to the process
Share internal data needed for ROI or workflow analysis
Schedule a technical validation or architecture review
Bring in the executive sponsor or final decision maker
Approve scope and design for a pilot or proof of concept

usage_guidelines: Score each live opportunity weekly across all five momentum signals.
Identify the weakest signal for each opportunity and define an appropriate Required Momentum Action.
Do not treat vendor-driven meetings as momentum without a corresponding buyer-led action.
Adjust forecast categories based on momentum score and presence or absence of an RMA.
Use longitudinal momentum scores to spot systemic issues in messaging, ICP fit, or sales execution.

example_opportunities.name: API Data Vendor → Hedge Fund
example_opportunities.context: Mid-stage evaluation for a new data feed powering systematic strategies.
example_opportunities.interpretation: Conditional positive momentum. Strong engagement but too few stakeholders involved.
example_opportunities.recommended_RMA: Ask champion to introduce the technology lead and risk stakeholder.

example_opportunities.name: Risk Analytics Platform → Global Bank
example_opportunities.context: Opportunity has been in 'evaluation' for several months with intermittent contact.
example_opportunities.interpretation: Stalled opportunity with weak internal activity and narrow stakeholder set.
example_opportunities.recommended_RMA: Secure a meeting with the original sponsor to clarify current priorities and either re-scope or consciously de-prioritize the deal.
